intro: Oldenlandia uhligii, commonly known as the "silver vine," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit, opposite leaves, and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name.
